intro: Coronanthera aspera, commonly known as the rough coronanthera, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the Orchidaceae family and is characterized by its unique, spurred flowers that are typically violet or purple in color. The plant has linear, grass-like leaves and produces small, clustered inflorescences. It thrives in rocky or sandy soils and is often found in coastal or inland regions. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens, though it requires well-drained conditions to flourish.
